law.catch_line: Applications for assistance -- Airport loan committee, functions.
law.text:
A local airport board may apply to the secretary of the Transportation Cabinet for assistance in carrying out any project authorized by KRS 183.132 to 183.138 and KRS 183.762 to 183.772. The secretary shall approve or disapprove the application subject to the provisions of KRS 183.200 to 183.213 and the regulations of the cabinet.
In considering applications submitted pursuant to subsection (1) of this section, the Governor may appoint an airport loan committee consisting of not less than three
nor more than five (5) citizens of the Commonwealth interested in airport development who shall upon the request of the secretary review the applications and make recommendations to the secretary. (3) Members of the committee shall receive twenty-five dollars ($25) for each day in actual session and shall be reimbursed for travel expenses and other reasonable expenses incident to performance of their duties.
